edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity, java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements Entity, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the player in the game. This class will take commands from the UI to take certain actions such as moving and shooting.
    Author:
    Natanael Ariawan, David Hau, Miguel Menjivar, Aidan Novobilski
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.Entity

        Entity.entityType

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int ammo
      This field represents the player's current ammo.
      private int lives
      This field represents the number of lives the player has remaining.
      private int maxAmmo
      This field represents the number of bullets the player can hold.
      private static long serialVersionUID
      This field represents the unique ID used for saving and loading via serialization.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(int maxAmmo)
      This constructor method sets the fields lives to 3, maxAmmo to whatever the max ammo the player can hold, which is based on the magazine Shop upgrade, and reloads the gun using the method, reload().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void gainLife(int life)
      This method increases the player's life by the number specified when the player moves onto the next level.
      int getAmmo()
      This method retrieves the player's current ammo count.
      Entity.entityType getEntityType()
      This method will return the type of the entity.
      int getLives()
      This method gets the current lives of the player to be used in the game engine and UI, as well as to be interacted upon by other entities in the game.
      int getMaxAmmo()
      This method retrieves the max ammo that the player can hold.
      void loseLife()
      This method decreases the player's life by 1, which will be called when the player is killed by an adjacent ninja.
      void reload()
      This method allows the player to reload their gun, which sets the field ammo equal to the player's maxAmmo.
      void setMaxAmmo(int maxAmmo)
      This method sets the player's max ammo to a specified max ammo.
      void shoot()
      This method reduces the player's ammo by 1, which will be called when the player successfully shoots (which will only be possible if the player has one or more ammo).
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method will return the symbol of the entity on the map as a string.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        This field represents the unique ID used for saving and loading via serialization.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • lives

        private int lives
        This field represents the number of lives the player has remaining.

      • ammo

        private int ammo
        This field represents the player's current ammo. This field can be altered by the method shoot() and reload() and is set with the constructor method, Player(int).

      • maxAmmo

        private int maxAmmo
        This field represents the number of bullets the player can hold. This field is initialized in the constructor method, Player(int), through the method setMaxAmmo(int).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int maxAmmo)
        This constructor method sets the fields lives to 3, maxAmmo to whatever the max ammo the player can hold, which is based on the magazine Shop upgrade, and reloads the gun using the method, reload().
        Parameters:
        maxAmmo - an int that represents the max ammo the player can hold

    • Method Detail

      • getAmmo

        public int getAmmo()
        This method retrieves the player's current ammo count.
        Returns:
        an int representing the player's current ammo count

      • getMaxAmmo

        public int getMaxAmmo()
        This method retrieves the max ammo that the player can hold.
        Returns:
        an int representing the max ammo that the player can hold

      • getLives

        public int getLives()
        This method gets the current lives of the player to be used in the game engine and UI, as well as to be interacted upon by other entities in the game.
        Returns:
        the current lives of the player

      • setMaxAmmo

        public void setMaxAmmo(int maxAmmo)
        This method sets the player's max ammo to a specified max ammo. The parameter value will be dictated by the magazine upgrade in the Shop.
        Parameters:
        maxAmmo - an int that represents what the player's max ammo is supposed to be

      • gainLife

        public void gainLife(int life)
        This method increases the player's life by the number specified when the player moves onto the next level. The number of lives the player gains will be dictated by the health upgrade in the Shop.
        Parameters:
        life - the number of lives the player is gains

      • loseLife

        public void loseLife()
        This method decreases the player's life by 1, which will be called when the player is killed by an adjacent ninja.

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        This method reduces the player's ammo by 1, which will be called when the player successfully shoots (which will only be possible if the player has one or more ammo).

      • reload

        public void reload()
        This method allows the player to reload their gun, which sets the field ammo equal to the player's maxAmmo.
